title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks: Sheep Creek Campground
body: Sheep Creek Campground       Sheep Creek campground is located on Highway 180, ¼ mile from Cedar Grove Village. The campground is situated in the canyon near the Middle Fork of the Kings River.      Region   Cedar Grove area in Kings Canyon     Elevation   4,600 ft. (1,402 m)     Open   In 2016, the opening was delayed while many drought- and insect-killed trees were being removed. It re-opened on June 10th. At the end of summer, the campground is scheduled to close on September 21.     Reservations   No reservations; first-come, first-serve     Fee   $18/night     Number of sites   111     RV/Trailer  length   Varies     Hookups   None    Generator hours Use from 9 a.m. - 9 p.m. only!    Pets   Permitted (Learn more about pet regulations)     Dump station   None. Nearest dump station (summer only): Princess Campground (Hwy 180 at Hume Lake junction) in Sequoia National Forest     Groceries, showers, laundry   ¼ mile at Cedar Grove Village     Accessibility         Ranger Programs   July and August     Phone   ¼ mile at Cedar Grove Village     Restrooms   Flush toilets     Food storage   Metal food locker - 48"W x 34"D x 28"H     Nearby Attractions   Horseback riding     You are required to store food properly in order to protect bears. Learn more about bears and food storage in the parks. Download the Sheep Creek campground map for a larger, printable image. (PDF)
